info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 1:01AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Fog Developing Across East Central Florida... At 100 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed widespread low clouds and light mist across much of east central Florida. Visibilities in most areas was between 3 and 5 miles, however, some locations were starting to drop below 1 mile. The fog is expected to persist through 8 or 9 AM this morning, with visibilities below 1 mile having the potential to increase in coverage. Persons who will be out driving early Thanksgiving morning should prepare to encounter rapid lowering of visibilities in fog. When driving in dense fog, reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra following distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.
